sburjan - (09:50): anyone here running the latest snapshot ?  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 09:58

sburjan - (10:38): vmassol1: I am trying to test the latest XEM, but I can't find the package xwiki-enterprise-manager-mysql-<version>.zip  
vmassol1 - (10:39): sburjan: http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/manager/xwiki-enterprise-manager-mysql/2.6/  
sburjan - (10:39): :( I wanted the 2.7  
tmortagne - (10:39): note: mysql package is built only for releases  
sburjan - (10:39): oh i see  
sburjan - (10:39): so untill release, i can't test xem 2.7  
vmassol1 - (10:40): you can but it's not prebuilt, that said the prebuild is only about putting the mysql jar  
tmortagne - (10:40): sburjan: just take the hsqldb one and change the db configuration file and put mysql jar  
vmassol1 - (10:40): and editing hibernate.cfg.xml  
tmortagne - (10:40): it's realy not much  
tmortagne - (10:41): you can also build the mysql package on trunk ;)  
tmortagne - (10:41): which is not very hard either  
sburjan - (10:42): I'm not still familiar with manager dir structure .. there are a lot of dirs and I don't know exactly which does what  
sburjan - (10:42): I will try the hsqldb thing  
sburjan - (10:43): so first step is to download this : http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/manager/xwiki-enterprise-manager-hsqldb/2.7-SNAPSHOT/  
sburjan - (10:43): stop ne if I am doing something wrong  
sburjan - (10:43): \*me  
tmortagne - (10:44): yep that's it  
sburjan - (10:44): the mysqjar is the same from XEM 2.6 ?  
sburjan - (10:44): \*mysql  
tmortagne - (10:45): yep  
sburjan - (10:46): I guess this is what I need : mysql-connector-java-5.1.6.jar  
tmortagne - (10:46): same for hibernate configuration  
tmortagne - (10:46): yep  
sburjan - (10:46): so I have to put it in /webapps/xwiki/libs  
tmortagne - (10:46): yep  
tmortagne - (10:47): and overwrite hibernate.cfg.xml file with the one from mysql package and you are done  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 10:51  
sburjan - (10:52): yes, server started, everything is okay. It's just it seems i didn't have to import xwiki-enterprise-manager-wiki-administrator-<version>.xar  
sburjan - (10:52): which I can't explain why  
vmassol1 - (10:52): because you already had a mysql db running somewhere  
sburjan - (10:53): yes, i have  
sburjan - (10:53): had and have  
tmortagne - (10:53): with an old instance already in it  
sburjan - (10:53): so XEM app actually resides in the db ?  
sburjan - (10:53): yes, exactly  
sburjan - (10:54): a 2.6 instance (in mysql)  
tmortagne - (10:54): everything resides in the db  
tmortagne - (10:54): every datas  
sburjan - (10:54): I imagined that the XAR pages are actually copied somewhere outside the database  
sburjan - (10:54): so actually the xwikipages are in database only ?  
sburjan - (10:55): this is a general question  
tmortagne - (10:55): what would be in the database then ? :)  
sburjan - (10:55): content of the pages > :P  
sburjan - (10:55): tags, comments, etc  
tmortagne - (10:55): so not content but metadatas then  
sburjan - (10:55): yes:)  
tmortagne - (10:56): thing is f you don't have all in the database you can't request it  
sburjan - (10:56): so when importing any XAR, all the xar contents is inserted into the DB ? (no additional files on disk) ?  
tmortagne - (10:56): yep nothing in disk  
sburjan - (10:56): interesting  
tmortagne - (10:56): that's the basics  
tmortagne - (10:56): it's not exactly true for extension manager  
tmortagne - (10:57): which has a local repository of the extensions but that's another thing  
sburjan - (10:57): yes, because extension manager downloads jar's .. and those aren't inserted in db  
tmortagne - (10:58): it also have xar in its repository but it's not for runtime, it's to keep a "safe" version of what it installed for upgrades  
sburjan - (10:58): yeah ...  
sburjan - (10:58): and for example if I want to "upgrade" the manager-administrator xar, I have to reimport it, right ?  
sburjan - (10:59): so a new version of pages will be created with the latest 2.7 snapshot  
tmortagne - (10:59): yes and take care of not importing pages you would have modified  
tmortagne - (10:59): but in your case you probably don't care  
tmortagne - (10:59): you want to put standard one  
sburjan - (11:00): I guess I should Un-check the import as default package (never knew what does this checkbox)  
sburjan - (11:02): tmortagne: do you accidentally have a XE 2.7 snapshot ?  
tmortagne - (11:02): i don't see what yopu mean by "import as default package"  
tmortagne - (11:02): sburjan: i don't have much, i'm on a temporary half installed dev env on win7  
sburjan - (11:03): Admin Section - Import - Upload Xar, press Import .. you have various options .. keep history, reset to version 1, and also impost as backup package  
sburjan - (11:03): backup package, not default, sorry  
tmortagne - (11:03): ok, in you case it's a backup import  
tmortagne - (11:03): don't disable it  
sburjan - (11:03): ok  
Menso joined #xwiki at 11:04  
sburjan - (11:04): I though if it's a backup, it won't be used at all  
tmortagne - (11:04): backup means keep author basically  
tmortagne - (11:04): and in XE/XEM you have rights settings  
tmortagne - (11:04): so author is important  
sburjan - (11:05): I see  
sburjan - (11:05): thanks for en-lighting me :)  
tmortagne - (11:05): you'r welcome  
Menso - (11:08): good morning  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:13  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 11:21  
sburjan - (11:27): I have a question. My XEM creates wikis with the URL : sorin.localdomain.com:8080 ... and they don't work  
sburjan - (11:27): created by prev version XEM (and they worked there)  
sburjan - (11:29): anf changing from localdomain.com to localhost, doesnt work even if the URL is correct  
sburjan - (11:33): any idea ?  
jvdrean - (11:40): sburjan: you need to use a real domain names (localhost won't handle subdomains) by redirecting them to localhost  
sburjan - (11:40): odd.. last time worked  
sburjan - (11:40): so basically i can't test XEM locally ?  
jvdrean - (11:41): for example in your /etc/hosts file you can add:  
jvdrean - (11:41): 127.0.0.1 localdomain.com  
jvdrean - (11:41): 127.0.0.1 www.localdomain.com  
jvdrean - (11:41): 127.0.0.1 test.localdomain.com  
sburjan - (11:41): oh,grea  
sburjan - (11:41): t  
sburjan - (11:41): thanks  
florinciu - (11:43): sburjan: you probably tested url based XEMs before. for subdomain based you always had to edit the hosts file.  
sburjan - (11:44): florinciu: i don't remember, when we tested together last time, did I modified the hosts file ?  
sburjan - (11:46): yes, works. Thanks jvdrean  
florinciu - (11:51): sburjan: no, when we tested together it was url based.

sburjan - (12:45): question : If I created a Wiki (as Admin from XEM) , I go to the created Instance, login as Admin, and I got Xapp Sheets, Xapp Templates and Xapp Classes. Without a home page (quetion mark next to them). Is this Normal ?  
sburjan - (12:46): (those are spaces)

tmortagne - (13:00): not nice but "normal"  
tmortagne - (13:02): that's XAAM-82  
tmortagne - (13:02): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XAAM-82

fransz joined #xwiki at 16:31  
fransz - (16:32): I updated to 2.6 and now I get an "MacroExecutionException: Nested scripts are not allowed" error. What does this mean?  
lucaa - (16:36): this is the issue: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5275  
silviar - (16:37): sdumitriu: Hi! is there an exe available? or should we only test the zip at http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/2.7-rc-1/ for now ?  
lucaa - (16:37): ( fransz )  
sdumitriu - (16:37): fransz: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise24#HNestedscriptmacrosareforbidden  
lucaa - (16:38): it's protecting the injection of scripts in scripts macros through the parameters or other user passed values, if I understood (and remember) correctly the explanation  
sdumitriu - (16:38): silviar: http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-installer-windows/2.7-rc-1/  
fransz - (16:38): I have this {{velocity}}#template("test.vm"){{/velocity}} on a page. And inside test.vm also contains {{velocity}} and {{/velocity}} around it's content.  
fransz - (16:39): Is that the problem?  
silviar - (16:39): sdumitriu: thanks, sorry for not spotting it  
sdumitriu - (16:39): fransz: Yes  
lucaa - (16:40): fransz: why do you need {{velocity}} in the .vm?  
lucaa - (16:40): sdumitriu: isn't that documentation a little outdated? aren't the includes executed now?  
lucaa - (16:40): (there is an exception)  
sdumitriu - (16:41): lucaa: It's not about includes, but about scripts that are inside the included docs  
fransz - (16:41): lucaa: I don't know. I will try it without them.  
sdumitriu - (16:41): It's a "watch out for this hidden nested situation" example  
lucaa - (16:41): sdumitriu: yes, but I think there is an exception for includes right now, iirc  
fransz - (16:41): Can I change files inside xwiki/templates without an restart of tomcat?  
sdumitriu - (16:41): lucaa: Shouldn't be, are you sure?  
sdumitriu - (16:42): fransz: Yes, all except macros.vm which does require a restart  
lucaa - (16:42): sdumitriu: not 100%, I can test. But if it isn't then Main.Dashboard cannot work because it uses conditional includes, which you cannot do otherwise  
fransz - (16:42): sdumitriu, lucaa: I have removed the {{velocity}} tag inside of test.vm. Now it is working again! Thank you. :-)  
Menso joined #xwiki at 16:45

sburjan - (18:56): sdumitriu: I've seen you didn't committed the IRC patch  
sdumitriu - (18:56): Not yet, I had a question  
sburjan - (18:56): ok, we'll talk after the release .. so I don't keep you busy  
sdumitriu - (18:57): Here:  
sdumitriu - (18:57): +        def User[] pircUsers = this.getUsers(channel)  
sdumitriu - (18:57): +        for (User singleUser in pircUsers) {  
sdumitriu - (18:57): +              if (singleUser.equals(sender)) {  
sdumitriu - (18:57): +                     log(channel, "${date} <${singleUser.getPrefix()}${sender}> ${message}\n")  
sdumitriu - (18:57): +              }  
sdumitriu - (18:57): +        }  
sburjan - (18:57): yes  
sdumitriu - (18:57): There's a race condition  
sburjan - (18:57): wdym ?  
sdumitriu - (18:58): It is possible that the user leaves right after sending the message, so he won't be in pircUsers  
sdumitriu - (18:58): So the if condition is never true  
sdumitriu - (18:58): So, inside the if you should just compute the prefix  
sdumitriu - (18:58): And do the log outside the for  
sburjan - (18:58): basically that is triggered on event of Message, and i get the whole chan list, search for the user, get his status  
sburjan - (18:58): oh, I see  
sburjan - (18:59): but i don't understand how moving the log function out of the if will fix the issue  
sburjan - (19:00): you want to separate the singleUser.getprefix() of logging, so if singleUser.getPrefix() fails, the line to be logged anyway ?  
sburjan - (19:00): this is what you are saying >  
sdumitriu - (19:08): Yes  
sburjan - (19:09): ok  
sdumitriu - (19:09): I'll do it now  
sburjan - (19:09): okay. thanks  
jvdrean left at 19:23 (Quit: Leaving.  
sburjan left at 19:28 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
florinciu left at 19:47 (Quit: Leaving.  
mflorea - (19:50): sdumitriu: I debugged the office importer on sburjan's machine and there is indeed a problem. We have two jars in WEB-INF/lib for JSON processing: json-20080701.jar and org.json-2.0.jar The first one is an optional dependency of jodconverter, required only if you use the JsonDocumentFormatRegistry -->  so in order to enable jSON configuration for office importer I had to add json-20080701.jar as dependency of office importer, which works fine. It seems that   
mflorea - (19:50): // This is a nice array  
mflorea - (19:50): [1, 2, ,3]  
mflorea - (19:50): is parsed by json-20080701.jar but not by org.json-2.0.jar  
mflorea - (19:50): I'll investigate this problem a bit later. Now I have to finish something else. I suspect we have to exclude org.json-2.0.jar as a transitive dependency.

sburjan` - (21:06): sdumitriu: indeed me messages aren't logged. they never were. we don't have an event for that  
sdumitriu - (21:07): Something to fix care in the future, if possible  
sdumitriu - (21:08): sburjan`: Do you want to take ownership of the IRCBot application?
